channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unraveling Batch Normalization for Realistic Test-Time Adaptation
item.description: While recent test-time adaptations exhibit efficacy by adjusting batch normalization to narrow domain disparities, their effectiveness diminishes with realistic mini-batches due to inaccurate target estimation.

item.title: Improving Cross-domain Few-shot Classification with Multilayer Perceptron
item.description: Multilayer perceptron (MLP) has shown its capability to learn transferable representations in various downstream tasks, such as unsupervised image classification and supervised concept generalization.

item.title: PPFM: Image denoising in photon-counting CT using single-step posterior sampling Poisson flow generative models
item.description: Diffusion and Poisson flow models have shown impressive performance in a wide range of generative tasks, including low-dose CT image denoising.

item.title: LogoStyleFool: Vitiating Video Recognition Systems via Logo Style Transfer
item.description: We separate the attack into three stages: style reference selection, reinforcement-learning-based logo style transfer, and perturbation optimization.

item.title: Osprey: Pixel Understanding with Visual Instruction Tuning
item.description: In this paper, we propose Osprey, a mask-text instruction tuning approach, to extend MLLMs by incorporating fine-grained mask regions into language instruction, aiming at achieving pixel-wise visual understanding.

item.title: Hypergraph-MLP: Learning on Hypergraphs without Message Passing
item.description: Hypergraphs are vital in modelling data with higher-order relations containing more than two entities, gaining prominence in machine learning and signal processing.

item.title: Grammatical information in BERT sentence embeddings as two-dimensional arrays
item.description: Next, we show that various architectures can detect patterns in these two-dimensional reshaped sentence embeddings and successfully learn a model based on smaller amounts of simpler training data, which performs well on more complex test data.

item.title: Exploring Automatic Text Simplification of German Narrative Documents
item.description: In this paper, we apply transformer-based Natural Language Generation (NLG) techniques to the problem of text simplification.

item.title: Ins-HOI: Instance Aware Human-Object Interactions Recovery
item.description: To this end, we introduce an instance-level occupancy field to support simultaneous human/hand and object representation, and a complementary training strategy to handle the lack of instance-level ground truths.

item.title: Understanding Probe Behaviors through Variational Bounds of Mutual Information
item.description: With the success of self-supervised representations, researchers seek a better understanding of the information encapsulated within a representation.

item.title: Hierarchical Graph Pattern Understanding for Zero-Shot VOS
item.description: However, existing optical flow-based methods have a significant dependency on optical flow, which results in poor performance when the optical flow estimation fails for a particular scene.

item.title: Context-Aware Sequential Model for Multi-Behaviour Recommendation
item.description: Sequential recommendation models are crucial for next-item recommendations in online platforms, capturing complex patterns in user interactions.

item.title: Multi-Modality is All You Need for Transferable Recommender Systems
item.description: To align the cross-modal item representations, we propose a novel next-item enhanced cross-modal contrastive learning objective, which is equipped with both inter- and intra-modality negative samples and explicitly incorporates the transition patterns of user behaviors into the item encoders.

item.title: Part Representation Learning with Teacher-Student Decoder for Occluded Person Re-identification
item.description: In addition, existing occluded person ReID benchmarks utilize occluded samples as queries, which will amplify the role of alleviating occlusion interference and underestimate the impact of the feature absence issue.

item.title: MobileSAMv2: Faster Segment Anything to Everything
item.description: The efficiency bottleneck of SegEvery with SAM, however, lies in its mask decoder because it needs to first generate numerous masks with redundant grid-search prompts and then perform filtering to obtain the final valid masks.

item.title: Rethinking Causal Relationships Learning in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: In order to comprehensively analyze various GNN models from a causal learning perspective, we constructed an artificially synthesized dataset with known and controllable causal relationships between data and labels.

item.title: Prompt-based Distribution Alignment for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: Therefore, in this paper, we first experimentally demonstrate that the unsupervised-trained VLMs can significantly reduce the distribution discrepancy between source and target domains, thereby improving the performance of UDA.

item.title: Deep Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Time Series Classification: a Benchmark
item.description: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims to harness labeled source data to train models for unlabeled target data.

item.title: Point Transformer V3: Simpler, Faster, Stronger
item.description: This paper is not motivated to seek innovation within the attention mechanism.

item.title: Let All be Whitened: Multi-teacher Distillation for Efficient Visual Retrieval
item.description: Instead of crafting a new method pursuing further improvement on accuracy, in this paper we propose a multi-teacher distillation framework Whiten-MTD, which is able to transfer knowledge from off-the-shelf pre-trained retrieval models to a lightweight student model for efficient visual retrieval.

item.title: Temporally and Distributionally Robust Optimization for Cold-start Recommendation
item.description: They learn a feature extractor on warm-start items to align feature representations with interactions, and then leverage the feature extractor to extract the feature representations of cold-start items for interaction prediction.

item.title: PathoDuet: Foundation Models for Pathological Slide Analysis of H&E and IHC Stains
item.description: In this work, we present PathoDuet, a series of pretrained models on histopathological images, and a new self-supervised learning framework in histopathology.

item.title: SlimmeRF: Slimmable Radiance Fields
item.description: To this end, we present SlimmeRF, a model that allows for instant test-time trade-offs between model size and accuracy through slimming, thus making the model simultaneously suitable for scenarios with different computing budgets.

item.title: Fine-Tuned Self-Supervised Speech Representations for Language Diarization in Multilingual Code-Switched Speech
item.description: Annotating a multilingual code-switched corpus is a painstaking process requiring specialist linguistic expertise.

item.title: Collaborating Foundation models for Domain Generalized Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Domain Generalized Semantic Segmentation (DGSS) deals with training a model on a labeled source domain with the aim of generalizing to unseen domains during inference.

item.title: PAC-Bayes Generalisation Bounds for Dynamical Systems Including Stable RNNs
item.description: In this paper, we derive a PAC-Bayes bound on the generalisation gap, in a supervised time-series setting for a special class of discrete-time non-linear dynamical systems.

item.title: Learning Distributions on Manifolds with Free-form Flows
item.description: Many real world data, particularly in the natural sciences and computer vision, lie on known Riemannian manifolds such as spheres, tori or the group of rotation matrices.

item.title: Calibrated One Round Federated Learning with Bayesian Inference in the Predictive Space
item.description: To improve scalability for larger models, one common Bayesian approach is to approximate the global predictive posterior by multiplying local predictive posteriors.

item.title: TF-CLIP: Learning Text-free CLIP for Video-based Person Re-Identification
item.description: Technically, TMC allows the frame-level memories in a sequence to communicate with each other, and to extract temporal information based on the relations within the sequence.

item.title: TOP-ReID: Multi-spectral Object Re-Identification with Token Permutation
item.description: In addition, most of current Transformer-based ReID methods only utilize the global feature of class tokens to achieve the holistic retrieval, ignoring the local discriminative ones.

item.title: MONET: Modality-Embracing Graph Convolutional Network and Target-Aware Attention for Multimedia Recommendation
item.description: In this paper, we focus on multimedia recommender systems using graph convolutional networks (GCNs) where the multimodal features as well as user-item interactions are employed together.

item.title: Toward Deep Drum Source Separation
item.description: In the past, the field of drum source separation faced significant challenges due to limited data availability, hindering the adoption of cutting-edge deep learning methods that have found success in other related audio applications.

item.title: Human Perception-Inspired Grain Segmentation Refinement Using Conditional Random Fields
item.description: Accurate segmentation of interconnected line networks, such as grain boundaries in polycrystalline material microstructures, poses a significant challenge due to the fragmented masks produced by conventional computer vision algorithms, including convolutional neural networks.

item.title: Probabilistic learning of the Purkinje network from the electrocardiogram
item.description: Our methodology is a step forward in creation of digital twins from non-invasive data in precision medicine.

item.title: SMILE: Multimodal Dataset for Understanding Laughter in Video with Language Models
item.description: We introduce this new task to explain why people laugh in a particular video and a dataset for this task.

item.title: Riveter: Measuring Power and Social Dynamics Between Entities
item.description: Riveter provides a complete easy-to-use pipeline for analyzing verb connotations associated with entities in text corpora.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning for Anomalous Sound Detection
item.description: However, the less difficult the classification task becomes, the less informative are the embeddings and the worse is the resulting ASD performance.

item.title: Improving Biomedical Entity Linking with Retrieval-enhanced Learning
item.description: Biomedical entity linking (BioEL) has achieved remarkable progress with the help of pre-trained language models.

item.title: Faster Diffusion: Rethinking the Role of UNet Encoder in Diffusion Models
item.description: This finding inspired us to omit the encoder at certain adjacent time-steps and reuse cyclically the encoder features in the previous time-steps for the decoder.

item.title: OTOv3: Automatic Architecture-Agnostic Neural Network Training and Compression from Structured Pruning to Erasing Operators
item.description: Compressing a predefined deep neural network (DNN) into a compact sub-network with competitive performance is crucial in the efficient machine learning realm.

item.title: Discovering Highly Influential Shortcut Reasoning: An Automated Template-Free Approach
item.description: Shortcut reasoning is an irrational process of inference, which degrades the robustness of an NLP model.

item.title: Multi-stage Learning for Radar Pulse Activity Segmentation
item.description: Radio signal recognition is a crucial function in electronic warfare.

item.title: nuScenes Knowledge Graph -- A comprehensive semantic representation of traffic scenes for trajectory prediction
item.description: Further, we present nuScenes Knowledge Graph (nSKG), a knowledge graph for the nuScenes dataset, that models explicitly all scene participants and road elements, as well as their semantic and spatial relationships.

item.title: CT-MVSNet: Efficient Multi-View Stereo with Cross-scale Transformer
item.description: Recent deep multi-view stereo (MVS) methods have widely incorporated transformers into cascade network for high-resolution depth estimation, achieving impressive results.

item.title: UCMCTrack: Multi-Object Tracking with Uniform Camera Motion Compensation
item.description: In response to this, we introduce UCMCTrack, a novel motion model-based tracker robust to camera movements.

item.title: WIT-UAS: A Wildland-fire Infrared Thermal Dataset to Detect Crew Assets From Aerial Views
item.description: We present the Wildland-fire Infrared Thermal (WIT-UAS) dataset for long-wave infrared sensing of crew and vehicle assets amidst prescribed wildland fire environments.

item.title: Towards Robust and Expressive Whole-body Human Pose and Shape Estimation
item.description: Whole-body pose and shape estimation aims to jointly predict different behaviors (e. g., pose, hand gesture, facial expression) of the entire human body from a monocular image.

item.title: Learning a Low-Rank Feature Representation: Achieving Better Trade-Off between Stability and Plasticity in Continual Learning
item.description: This approach optimizes network parameters in the null space of the past tasks' feature representation matrix to guarantee the stability.

item.title: Detecting value-expressive text posts in Russian social media
item.description: We aimed to find a model that can accurately detect value-expressive posts in Russian social media VKontakte.

item.title: EAT: Towards Long-Tailed Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: The main difficulty lies in distinguishing OOD data from samples belonging to the tail classes, as the ability of a classifier to detect OOD instances is not strongly correlated with its accuracy on the in-distribution classes.
